name: Red Berry Pudding with Vanilla Sauce
ingredients: 800 g berries (fresh or frozen); water as needed; 6 packets cake glaze (Tortenguss), more if needed; 4 tbsp sugar; 2 packets vanilla sauce powder; 500 ml milk
preparation: Place berries in a pot, cover lightly with water, bring to a boil. Mix cake glaze with a little water, add to boiling berries, briefly boil, remove from heat, and sweeten with sugar; add extra glaze if needed for thicker consistency. For vanilla sauce, mix powder with cold milk, bring remaining milk to a boil, stir in powder mixture, boil briefly, then cool. Serve both well chilled in dessert bowls. Suitable with all red fruits such as strawberries, raspberries, red currants, or cherries.

name: Apple Cake with Vanilla Pudding
ingredients: 250 g flour; 100 g sugar; 125 g margarine; 2 packets vanilla sugar; 1 packet baking powder; 1 egg; 1 kg apples; 750 ml apple juice; 180 g sugar; 2 packets vanilla pudding powder
preparation: Make a dough from flour, sugar, margarine, vanilla sugar, baking powder, and egg. Line a springform pan with the dough, pulling the edges up. Peel, core, and chop apples, place in pan. Bring apple juice and sugar to a boil, mix some cold juice with pudding powder, stir into boiling juice until thickened. Pour pudding over apples, bake at 175°C for 1 hour, covering with parchment toward the end to prevent over-browning.

name: Oat Bran Pancakes with Apple Compote
ingredients: 16 tbsp oat bran flakes; 8 tbsp whole wheat flour; 500 ml milk (1.5% fat); 4 eggs (medium); 8 tbsp low-fat quark; 2 tsp salt; 4 tsp vegetable oil; 4 jars unsweetened apple compote (350 g each)
preparation: Mix oat bran, whole wheat flour, milk, egg whites, quark, and salt thoroughly with a mixer. Heat oil in a pan, pour batter with a ladle, and fry small pancakes 3–4 minutes per side until crispy and golden. Serve with apple compote.

name: Quark-Mandarin Dessert
ingredients: 1000 g low-fat quark; 2 cups cream; 2 small cans drained mandarins; 6 tbsp sugar (adjust to taste or use sweetener); 2 packets vanilla sugar
preparation: Whip cream with vanilla sugar until stiff. Mix quark with remaining sugar until smooth, fold in whipped cream. Blend mandarins with a mixer, leaving small pieces for texture, and fold into quark mixture. Optionally, use 20% quark without cream and sweetener to reduce calories.

name: Marzipan Cake
ingredients: 175 g wheat flour; 75 g sugar; 100 g butter or margarine; 1 egg; 4 eggs; 4 tbsp hot water; 130 g sugar; 1 packet vanilla sugar; 100 g wheat flour; 2 tsp baking powder; 100 g cornstarch; 200 g walnuts; 100 g marzipan; 60 g sugar; 5 cups sweet cream (200 g each); 2 packets instant gelatin; 0.5 jar apricot jam; 1 marzipan cover
preparation: Make shortcrust dough, rest 1 hour in fridge, roll out and bake 15–20 min, cut to size. For sponge, beat eggs with hot water, add sugar and vanilla sugar, fold in sifted flour, baking powder, cornstarch, bake 35 min, cool and slice twice. Caramelize chopped walnuts with sugar, mix with marzipan, cool. Whip cream with gelatin and fold in nut-marzipan mix. Assemble cake: spread apricot jam on shortcrust, layer sponge and cream-nut mixture, repeat, chill several hours or overnight. Cover with whipped cream and marzipan sheet, decorate with remaining walnuts. This recipe takes a long time to prepare.

name: Marzipan-Apple Muffins with Cinnamon Streusel
ingredients: 100 g butter; 200 g flour; 2 tsp baking powder; 100 g marzipan; 2 eggs; 200 g sour cream; 80 g sugar; 1 tsp cinnamon; 2 small apples (200–300 g) | For streusel: 70 g butter; 1 tsp cinnamon; 100 g flour; 70 g sugar; 1 pinch salt | For glaze: 24 tbsp powdered sugar; 4 tbsp lemon juice
preparation: Cut marzipan into small pieces, peel and slice apples. Mix butter and sugar, add eggs, sour cream, and cinnamon. Fold in sifted flour and baking powder, then marzipan and apples. Melt butter for streusel, mix with remaining ingredients, sprinkle over muffins. Bake at 180?°C for 25–30 min. Mix powdered sugar with lemon juice and drizzle over cooled muffins.

name: Franzbrötchen
ingredients: Ingredients for dough: 250 g flour; 20 g yeast; 35 g sugar; 125 ml lukewarm milk; 35 g butter; ½ pinch salt; zest of ½ lemon | For filling: 100 g butter; 100 g sugar; 1 tsp cinnamon; flour for rolling; fat for baking sheet
preparation: Mix flour, yeast, ½ sugar, and milk in a bowl, let yeast dissolve. Add butter, remaining sugar, salt, and lemon zest. Knead to a smooth dough, cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled, 30–40 min. Roll dough to rectangle ~30×25?cm. Layer with butter slices, fold, roll to 30×50?cm, fold into thirds, chill 15?min. Roll to 80×40?cm, brush with water, sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Roll into log, cut into 4?cm pieces, press with spoon handle. Place on greased baking sheet, let rise 15–20?min. Bake at 200?°C for 15–25?min.

name: Apple Compote with Cinnamon Cream and Crumble
ingredients: 560 g apples, peeled and sliced; 3.2 tbsp raw cane sugar; 0.8 tonka bean, grated | For the cream: 560 ml milk; 1.6 tbsp raw cane sugar; 1.6 packets instant custard powder; 3.2 tsp ground cinnamon; 160 ml liquid cream | For the crumble: 40 g butter; 40 g raw cane sugar; 160 g spelt flour type 630; 3.2 pinch ground cinnamon
preparation: Cook apple slices with sugar and tonka bean for 3 min., then cool. Cook milk with sugar, custard powder, and cinnamon into thick custard, cover and cool, fold in cream. Mix butter, sugar, flour, and cinnamon for crumble, bake at 180?°C for 15–20 min. Layer in dessert glasses: 1 tbsp compote, 2 tbsp cinnamon cream, remaining compote, chill, sprinkle crumble on top before serving.

name: Espresso Cream
ingredients: 16 sheets gelatin; 8 packets vanilla sugar; 1 liter espresso coffee; 12 egg yolks; 240 g sugar; 800 g heavy cream; sour cherries, optional
preparation: Soak the gelatin sheets in cold water until softened. Gently heat the espresso in a double boiler, taking care not to let it boil. Gradually whisk in the egg yolks one by one, followed by the vanilla sugar and granulated sugar. Continue whisking the mixture over the water bath until it thickens. Add the soaked but undissolved gelatin directly to the cream and continue whisking until fully incorporated. Remove the bowl from the heat and continue whisking for a few minutes until the mixture cools slightly. Whip the cream until stiff and gently fold it into the espresso mixture. Spoon the cream into dessert glasses and chill for about 3 hours before serving. The dessert pairs exceptionally well with sour cherries.

name: Panna Cotta
ingredients: 24 tbsp heavy cream (or crèmefine); 1000 ml milk; 4 vanilla pods (or 1 packet vanilla sugar); 12 sheets gelatin; 8 tbsp sugar; fruit sauce of compote
preparation: Combine the cream and milk in a saucepan. Add the vanilla pods and sugar and bring to a boil. Let the mixture simmer gently for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, soak the gelatin sheets in cold water according to package instructions. Squeeze out the excess water and dissolve the gelatin in the hot milk mixture. Pour the mixture into suitable molds or glasses and chill for about 2 hours until set. Turn the panna cotta out onto plates and serve. It is best accompanied by a fruit sauce or fruit compote.

name: Crème Brûlée
ingredients: 800 ml heavy cream (high fat); 280 ml whole milk; 170 g brown sugar or white sugar; 10 egg yolks; 2 vanilla pods, seeds scraped (optionally a little liquid vanilla extract); finely grated lemon zest; fine white sugar, for caramelizing
preparation: Whisk together the cream, milk, and egg yolks. Add the sugar, vanilla seeds, and lemon zest, mixing well. Never add sugar directly onto unbeaten egg yolks, as this can cause lumps that will not dissolve properly. Let the mixture rest for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to develop. Pour the mixture into heatproof ramekins (either 4 large or 6 smaller ones). Place the ramekins in a deep baking tray on the middle rack of a preheated oven at 150 °C (300 °F) using top and bottom heat. Carefully pour boiling water into the tray until it reaches the rim of the ramekins, creating a water bath. Bake for about 55 minutes until the custard has set; the surface may appear slightly bubbly or browned, which is normal. Remove the ramekins and allow them to cool completely, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight. For best results, chill briefly in the freezer before caramelizing. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of fine white sugar evenly over each custard. Caramelize the sugar under the oven grill or with a kitchen torch until a crisp, golden crust forms. Let the sugar harden briefly before serving.

name: Tarte au Citron – French Lemon Cake
ingredients: 300 g flour; 150 g butter; 60 g sugar; 2 egg yolks; 2 tbsp water; butter, for greasing the pan; dried beans or peas, for blind baking; 6 untreated lemons (juice and zest); 200 g butter, melted; 250 g sugar; 6 eggs; 4 tbsp crème fraîche
preparation: For the dough, combine the flour, butter, sugar, and egg yolks. Gradually stir in the water until a smooth dough forms. Let the dough rest for about 30 minutes. For the filling, peel a few strips of lemon zest using a vegetable peeler, then squeeze the lemons to extract the juice. Beat the melted butter, eggs, and sugar until creamy, then add the lemon juice, lemon zest, and crème fraîche. Roll out the dough and place it into a buttered springform or tart pan. Prick the base with a fork, cover with baking paper, and weigh it down with dried beans or peas. Blind bake at 180 °C (350 °F) for 20 minutes. Carefully remove the paper and weights, pour the filling onto the pre-baked crust, and bake for another 40 minutes at 180 °C until set. Let cool before serving.

name: English Cream & Cherry Trifle with Toasted Almonds
ingredients: 640 g plain cream cheese; 1.6 egg yolks; 3.2 cups heavy cream; 160 g sugar; 3.2 packets vanilla sugar; 1.6 packets whipping cream stabilizer; 1.6 jars sour cherries; 160 g sliced almonds; 3.2 tbsp sugar; 1.6 tbsp butter
preparation: Toast the sliced almonds with 1 tablespoon of sugar and the butter in a pan, stirring constantly, until lightly golden. Set aside and allow to cool completely. Whip one cup of the cream until stiff. In a separate bowl, mix the cream cheese, egg yolks, sugar, vanilla sugar, and cream stabilizer until smooth. Whip the remaining cream and gently fold it into the cream cheese mixture, followed by the first portion of whipped cream. Drain the sour cherries well. Layer the dessert in a glass bowl by first spreading a layer of the cream mixture, then a layer of cherries, followed by another layer of cream. Just before serving, sprinkle the toasted almonds over the top.

name: Peach Pudding
ingredients: 250 g flour; 250 g butter, softened; 150 g powdered sugar; 6 medium eggs; 1 tsp baking powder; seeds of 2 vanilla pods; 6 medium peaches or 1 can peaches
preparation: Preheat the oven to 175 °C (350 °F) using top and bottom heat. Grease a baking dish and dust it lightly with flour. Wash and peel the peaches, halve them, and cut into slices. If using canned peaches, drain them thoroughly. Cream the butter with the powdered sugar and vanilla seeds until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until the mixture is airy. Mix the flour with the baking powder and fold it into the batter. Arrange the peaches evenly in the prepared baking dish and cover them with the batter. Bake in the oven for about 35 minutes; if the peaches are very juicy or large, baking time may extend up to 45 minutes—cover with aluminum foil if necessary. Test for doneness with a skewer. Serve warm, dusted with powdered sugar. Delicious with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a little fresh cream.

name: Cinnamon Rolls – Swedish Kanelbullar
ingredients: 300 g butter or margarine; 1000 ml milk; 100 g fresh yeast; 300 g sugar; 2 tsp salt; 2 tsp ground cardamom; 2 kg wheat flour; flour, for the work surface; 150 g butter or margarine, softened; 200 g sugar; 2 tbsp ground cinnamon; 2 eggs, beaten, for brushing; sugar, for sprinkling
preparation: Melt the butter or margarine. Add the milk and warm the mixture to about 37 °C. Dissolve the yeast in the milk. Stir in the sugar, salt, cardamom, and most of the flour. Knead the dough until smooth and elastic, adding a little more flour if necessary. Cover the dough with a kitchen towel and let it rise for about 30–40 minutes. Turn the dough out onto a floured work surface and knead briefly. Divide it into three portions and roll each into a thin rectangular sheet. Spread with the softened butter or margarine. Mix the sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle generously over the dough. Roll each sheet up tightly and cut into slices about 4 cm thick. Place the rolls cut-side down on baking trays and let them rise again for about 30 minutes, until doubled in size. Preheat the oven to 250–275 °C using top and bottom heat. Brush the rolls with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake on the middle rack for about 5–8 minutes. Let cool under a kitchen towel.

name: Swedish Almond Cream Buns
ingredients: 300 g butter; 1000 ml milk; 100 g yeast (fresh or dry equivalent); 1 tsp salt; 300 g sugar; 2 tsp ground cardamom; 2 kg wheat flour; 2 eggs, beaten, for brushing; 200 ml hot milk, for the filling; 150 g sugar, for the filling; 250 g chopped almonds, for the filling; 500 ml whipped cream; powdered sugar, for dusting
preparation: Melt the butter and add the milk. Allow the mixture to cool to about 37 °C. Mix about 900 g of the flour with the yeast, sugar, and salt, then add the milk–butter mixture. Knead vigorously using a stand mixer or stir well by hand until a very soft dough forms. The remaining flour will be used later for shaping. Cover the dough and let it rise in a warm, draft-free place for about 45 minutes, until doubled in size. Transfer the dough to a floured surface, knead briefly, and divide into twelve equal portions. Shape into buns and place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Let rise again for about 30 minutes. Brush gently with beaten egg and bake in a preheated oven at 225 °C (fan-assisted) for 8–10 minutes until lightly golden. Allow the buns to cool completely. Cut a small lid off the top of each bun and carefully hollow out the center. Place the removed crumb into a bowl and mix with the hot milk, chopped almonds, and sugar until a soft, dough-like filling forms. Press the mixture evenly into the hollowed buns. Whip the cream until stiff and fill the buns generously. Replace the lids and dust with powdered sugar before serving.

name: Makówki – Polish Poppy Seed Dessert
ingredients: 500 g ground poppy seeds; 1 liter milk; 1 tbsp butter; 8 tbsp honey; 1 tsp ground cinnamon; 1 packet raisins; 0.5 packet rusks (zwieback); 80 g chopped almonds; 150 g sugar; flaked almonds
preparation: Bring the milk and butter to a boil in a large pot. Gradually stir in the ground poppy seeds using a wooden spoon, stirring constantly. Add the sugar, honey, cinnamon, raisins, and chopped almonds (adjust quantities to taste). Simmer over medium to low heat for about 30 minutes, stirring frequently. The poppy seed mixture should have the consistency of semolina pudding; if it becomes too thick, add a little milk or water. In a large glass bowl, layer the rusks and poppy seed mixture, starting and ending with the poppy seed mixture. Create about 3–4 layers of rusks in between. Finish by decorating the top with flaked almonds. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight to allow the flavors to meld. Makówki will keep in the refrigerator for up to one week.

name: Polish Pierogi with Blueberry Filling
ingredients: 740 g flour; 220 ml water; 2 eggs; 30 g butter, softened; 2 tsp salt; 500 g blueberries or strawberries; 8 tbsp sour cream or crème fraîche; cinnamon sugar, to taste
preparation: Knead the flour, eggs, softened butter, salt, and water using a stand mixer with a dough hook or by hand until a smooth dough forms that no longer sticks to the bowl. If the dough feels too firm or crumbly, add 1–2 small splashes of water until slightly elastic. Lightly flour the work surface, taking care not to use too much flour, as this can make the dough stiff. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1–3 mm. Cut out round circles using the rim of a glass. Gently stretch each circle slightly with your hands. Place a few blueberries in the center of each circle and fold the dough over to form a half-moon. Do not overfill; the berries must be fully enclosed. Press the edges firmly together and seal with a fork or by pinching small decorative folds. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil, similar to cooking pasta. Add the pierogi, leaving enough space so they do not stick together. Once they float to the surface, continue cooking for about 4 more minutes (slightly longer if frozen). Remove with a slotted spoon. Serve with a tablespoon of sour cream or crème fraîche and sprinkle generously with cinnamon sugar if desired.
